description: Explanations and reasoning for upgrade recommendations

furnace.detailed: Furnace level gates everything else in the game. Higher Furnace unlocks new buildings, higher troop tiers, and eventually Fire Crystal content at L30.

priority_by_phase.early_game: Critical - rush to L19 for Daybreak Island
priority_by_phase.mid_game: Critical - rush to L30 for FC unlock
priority_by_phase.late_game: High - FC progression unlocks higher tiers

war_academy.detailed: War Academy reduces troop training time and cost. At high levels, you train the same troops in half the time with fewer resources. Essential for rebuilding after SvS losses.

priority_by_phase.late_game: Critical - first FC investment after Furnace

spending_notes.f2p: Focus here - training efficiency compounds over time
spending_notes.whale: Still important but speedups reduce urgency

troops_train.detailed: Higher tier troops have better stats. T10+ troops significantly outperform lower tiers in combat. Training more troops = more power = better SvS performance.

priority_by_phase.late_game: Critical - T10 is the power tier

troops_promote.short: Convert existing troops to higher tier
troops_promote.detailed: Promotion converts lower tier troops to higher tier without full training cost. More efficient than training from scratch when you have excess lower-tier troops.

hero_gear_mastery.detailed: Mastery Forging adds percentage bonuses to hero combat stats. Each level increases ATK, DEF, and HP. Benefits multiply with hero level and skills.

priority_by_phase.late_game: High - start after Mythic gear obtained
priority_by_phase.endgame: High - push to L20 for max stats

spending_notes.f2p: Focus one hero at a time - partial mastery is inefficient

chief_gear.detailed: Chief Gear provides always-on stat bonuses. Higher tiers give more stats but cost significantly more. Red-1 is a good stopping point for non-whales.

priority_by_phase.late_game: Medium - diminishing returns at high tiers

spending_notes.f2p: Stop at Red-0 or Red-1 - higher tiers are whale territory
spending_notes.whale: Push to max for marginal gains

chief_charms.detailed: Charms provide independent stat bonuses across 6 slots. L1-11 are accessible to everyone. L12-16 require Gen 7 state and Jewel Secrets.

priority_by_phase.mid_game: High - push all slots to L11
priority_by_phase.late_game: Medium - wait for Gen 7 for L12+

spending_notes.f2p: Max at L11 until Gen 7 state, then slow progress

pets.detailed: Pets provide active combat skills (2-hour buffs) and passive stat bonuses. SSR pets have the best skills and highest level cap (100). Focus SSR pets first.

spending_notes.f2p: L60 is efficient stopping point - L70+ costs spike
spending_notes.whale: L100 SSR pets for max stats

daybreak_island.detailed: Tree of Life provides significant combat buffs (Health, Defense, Lethality). Requires wood investment via Dock. Buffs are always active once unlocked.

priority_by_phase.mid_game: High - rush Tree of Life L6 for Troops Health buff
priority_by_phase.late_game: Medium - complete to L10 for Lethality buff

research.detailed: Research provides permanent stat bonuses and unlocks features. Tool Enhancement reduces research time (critical). Economy research improves resource flow. Battle research gives power.

priority_by_phase.early_game: Critical - Tool Enhancement is top priority
priority_by_phase.mid_game: Critical - Tool Enhancement VII is a milestone

examples: Unlocking Daybreak Island at Furnace L19 opens combat buffs via Tree of Life
Unlocking FC content at Furnace L30 opens War Academy and advanced progression
Tool Enhancement VII provides max research speed - critical milestone for all players
War Academy FC5 provides 40% training efficiency - huge long-term savings
T10 Infantry training gives 1,200 power per troop - high efficiency
Chief Charm L15 gives 124,000 power for 600 guides - medium efficiency
Hero Gear Mastery L10 improves all combat stats by 15% - significant for rally leads
Tree of Life L10 improves Troop Lethality by 5% - affects all troops in combat
Chief Gear Red-2+ is whale territory for F2P players - resource cost spikes exponentially
Charm L12-16 is accessible for dolphins+ - requires Jewel Secrets from events

rally_attack.context: Attacking enemy castles, Bear Trap, Crazy Joe
rally_attack.key_principle: Only the top 4 highest-LEVEL expedition skills from all joiners apply

best_heroes.reason: Direct damage boost is the highest-value rally joiner skill

best_heroes.effect: Infantry attack boost scales with level
best_heroes.reason: Boosts the most common troop type in rallies

avoid.reason: Defensive skill - wrong for attack rallies, can bump out damage skills

rally_attack.no_hero_rule: If you don't have a good attack joiner hero, send troops only to avoid bumping out someone else's valuable skill

best_heroes.reason: Direct damage reduction is the highest-value defensive skill

exploration.key_principle: Exploration skills (left side) are used, not expedition skills

best_heroes.reason: Sustain keeps team alive through long fights

svs_march.key_principle: Your own expedition skills apply, plus formation bonuses

composition.rally_lead: Use your strongest heroes with maxed expedition skills
composition.filler: Use heroes that complement the rally lead's composition
composition.solo: Match hero class to your strongest troop type

why_not_reasons.efficiency_too_low: This upgrade's power gain per resource is below your efficiency threshold ({threshold}%). Consider higher-value options first.
why_not_reasons.not_unlocked: This system unlocks at {requirement}. Focus on reaching that milestone first.
why_not_reasons.wrong_phase: This upgrade is optimized for {target_phase} players. At your current phase ({current_phase}), prioritize {alternative} instead.
why_not_reasons.whale_only: This upgrade is primarily accessible to heavy spenders. F2P/low spenders should focus on {alternative} for better value.
why_not_reasons.wrong_focus: Your priority focus is {focus}. This upgrade benefits {other_focus} more. Consider switching focus or choosing {alternative}.
why_not_reasons.bottleneck_resource: You're likely bottlenecked on {resource}. This upgrade requires significant {resource} investment. Consider {alternative} which uses {other_resource} instead.
